unnormalised: IIT Delhi recently announced a new course on "AI for Beginners", starting 15/07/2024. The course aims to equip students with foundational knowledge in Artificial Intelligence, covering topics like Machine Learning (ML) and Natural Language Processing (NLP). Experts from companies like TCS and Infosys will be guest lecturers.
normalised: I-I-T Delhi recently announced a new course on "A-I for Beginners", starting fifteenth july two thousand and twenty four. The course aims to equip students with foundational knowledge in Artificial Intelligence, covering topics like Machine Learning (M-L) and Natural Language Processing (N-L-P). Experts from companies like T-C-S and Infosys will be guest lecturers.

unnormalised: The curriculum includes hands-on projects using Python 3.9 and TensorFlow 2.0. Participants will learn to build basic AI models for image recognition and text classification. There's a strong emphasis on ethical considerations in AI development, particularly concerning bias and fairness. The course fee is Rs. 25,000, but scholarships are available for deserving candidates.
normalised: The curriculum includes hands-on projects using Python three point nine and TensorFlow two point zero. Participants will learn to build basic A-I models for image recognition and text classification. There's a strong emphasis on ethical considerations in A-I development, particularly concerning bias and fairness. The course fee is rupees twenty five thousand, but scholarships are available for deserving candidates.

unnormalised: According to Prof. Ravi Kumar, head of the Computer Science department, "AI is transforming every sector, and it's crucial for students to have a solid understanding of its principles." He further added that 70% of graduates with AI skills are seeing a significant boost in their career prospects.
normalised: According to Professor Ravi Kumar, head of the Computer Science department, "A-I is transforming every sector, and it's crucial for students to have a solid understanding of its principles." He further added that seventy percent of graduates with A-I skills are seeing a significant boost in their career prospects.

unnormalised: The course is open to students from all backgrounds, with a minimum requirement of 10+2 with mathematics as a subject. The application deadline is 30/06/2024. Interested candidates can apply through the IIT Delhi website.
normalised: The course is open to students from all backgrounds, with a minimum requirement of ten plus two with mathematics as a subject. The application deadline is thirtieth june two thousand and twenty four. Interested candidates can apply through the I-I-T Delhi website.

unnormalised: This initiative is expected to bridge the skill gap in the AI domain and contribute to India's growing tech industry. With the demand for AI professionals increasing by 20% annually, this course offers a timely opportunity for students to enter a promising field.
normalised: This initiative is expected to bridge the skill gap in the A-I domain and contribute to India's growing tech industry. With the demand for A-I professionals increasing by twenty percent annually, this course offers a timely opportunity for students to enter a promising field.
